Class CharMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • CharMatrix
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    C4Game

    public class CharMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
    This class breaks down the game into basic data structures and primitive data types. It uses a matrix holding all of the positions, 0 for empty, 1 for red, 2 for yellow.
    Version:
    5/25/2020
    Author:
    Vivek Alumootil, Mihir Kelkar, Period - 4, Assignment - APCS Final Project Connect 4, Sources - None

      • setToken

        public int setToken(int row,
                    int col,
                    int value)
        Main algorithm in the game. Sets the grid at given location to value. Checks spots surrounding this location to determine whether the move results in a win for either player. It uses 3 for loops. One for verticals. Another for horizontals. A final loop for diagonals. If after these loops go and there is a 4-in-a-row, then the winner corresponds the value that was just inserted in position.
        Parameters:
        row - - row insertion value
        col - - col insertion value
        value - - 1 for red, 2 for yellow
        Returns:
        -1 if there's no winner, 1 if red wins, 2 if yellow wins

      • colAvailable

        public boolean colAvailable(int col)
        checks if the given column has any available slots.
        Parameters:
        col - - to be checked
        Returns:
        true if available, false if not

        Returns:
        int row value where the coin will drop to if played in that column

      • placeToken

        public int placeToken(int col,
                      int val)
        finds the row value associated with that column using helper methods, and calls setToken once row value is found
        Parameters:
        col - - intended column
        val - - 1 or 2 depending on who's turn it is
        Returns:
        -2 if column isn't available, or the potential values of setToken

      • removeToken

        public void removeToken(int col)
        removes a given token by replacing the value at the indicated column with 0.
        Parameters:

      • fourEqual

        public boolean fourEqual(int i1,
                         int j1,
                         int i2,
                         int j2,
                         int i3,
                         int j3,
                         int i4,
                         int j4)
        Determines if the 4 values at these 4 locations are all equal. This is the method used to check for a win.
        Parameters:
        i1 - - x of Loc1
        j1 - - y of Loc2
        i2 - - x of Loc2
        j2 - - y of Loc2
        i3 - - x of Loc3
        j3 - - y of Loc3
        i4 - - x of Loc4
        j4 - - y of Loc4
        Returns:
        true if they are, false if not.
